messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:The Term Unschooling was I need direction!   bound...
messages.msgSnippet: This is soo interesting Laura...  I m sorry to hear the struggle for you.  I always have the opposite going on. After relatives (usually with children) leave I
messages.messageBody:
This is soo interesting Laura... I'm sorry to hear the struggle for you. I
always have the opposite going on.
After relatives (usually with children) leave I feel so happy my children are who
they are....
It is hard to answer the questions about why my son, who is 8 isn't reading much
yet. I am always happy to see them go so I can look at my children from my own
eyes, and I know they are wonderful human beings...which is my goal!
Ann


>
> Thanks Ann. My daughter's birthday is next weekend. My parents and my in-laws
> will come. I love them all, but ... what is that feeling I'm trying to
> describe ... I feel pulled back into a "good little girl" role when they are
> here. Seeking approval. "Look, look at how great my kids are, gang! Aren't I
> DOING A GREAT JOB?"
>
> Yuck. They leave and I'm disgusted with myself. Sooo ... this time I am
> trying HARDER to remind myself to let my life speak for itself. What is that
> quote I can't call to mind right now? Something about not being able to hear
> your words because your personality is speaking too loudly? Is it Twain? Help.
>
> Sorry for the ramble.
>
> Laura
>
